questions.question: Which statement is true about SN2 mechanism?

answers.a: The rate of reaction increases on increasing strength of the nucleophile
answers.b: The reaction is faster in polar aprotic solvents
answers.c: The rate of reaction increases as the leaving group ability increases

explanations.d: Stronger the nucleophile, faster the SN2 reaction. Polar aprotic solvent solvate cations, makes anionic nucleophile more available for reaction, hence faster reaction. A better leaving group lowers the activation energy increasing rate of SN2 reaction.

questions.question: A SN2 reaction involves back side attack of nucleophile at the Œ±-carbon of substrate because:

answers.a: both nucleophile and leaving group are electron rich, nucleophilic attack occur from most distant position
answers.b: there is greater electron density on the back side of substrate
answers.c: there is enough physical space in the front side from where leaving group leaves the substrate
answers.d: substrate possesses a hole in the backside

explanations.a: Both nucleophile and leaving group are electron rich species, nucleophile attacks from backside (most remote position) to have minimum repulsion with leaving group.
explanations.c: Due to the presence of leaving group on front side there is less physical space for attack of nucleophile.
